questions.question: What is the derivative of a constant?
What does the Power Rule in calculus state?
options: The derivative of x to the power n is nx to the power (n-1)
The derivative of a function is equal to the function times the natural logarithm of the base
The integral of a function from a to b is the same as the integral from b to a
The derivative of the sum of two functions is equal to the sum of their derivatives
questions.correct_answer: The derivative of x to the power n is nx to the power (n-1)

questions.question: What does the integral of a function represent?
options: The rate of change of the function
The slope of the function at a given point
The area under the curve of the function
The maximum value of the function
questions.correct_answer: The area under the curve of the function

questions.question: If f(x) = x^3, what is f'(x)?
What is the fundamental theorem of calculus?
options: It states that differentiation and integration are inverse operations
It states that any continuous function has an antiderivative
It states that every polynomial of degree n has n roots
It states that the derivative of a product of two functions is the product of their derivatives
questions.correct_answer: It states that differentiation and integration are inverse operations

questions.question: What is the integral of 1/x dx from 1 to e?
What is the second derivative of a function known as?
options: The rate of change of the rate of change
questions.correct_answer: The rate of change of the rate of change

questions.question: If f(x) = e^x, what is f'(x)?
What is the integral of cos(x) dx from 0 to π/2?
What rule do we use to find the derivative of a product of two functions?
